author: potuz
content: <@!340345049063882753> <@!203220829473996800> <@!476250636548308992> still not enough data but it is starting to appear as a pattern that the Teku's improvements even though haven't reduced the minimal delay on slot 0, they have substantially reduced the maximum delay compared to the baseline on pyrmont. Still it is interesting to note that on slot 0, Teku's nodes are consistently above the 2 second mark, while baseline has a lot of points below this.

author: potuz
content: That's about 10K points total, will need an extra couple of days to confirm, but it looks that this is actually the case

author: potuz
content: For example I cannot distiguish EF Teku's from the newer commits, therefore it looks like the newer improvements didn't do much with respect to this issue

author: potuz
content: Ok, Perhaps all this data is skewed a lot by Nimbus, all the long points on slot 0 and 1 correspond to Nimbus nodes

author: potuz
content: I better post on the pyrmont channel

author: nishant0
content: I was planning to try out some improvements on prylabs side, but havent had the time. It should have allowed us to process slot 0 faster in the gossip layer

author: potuz
content: Unfortunately I don't have prysm points in the last couple of days (I am filtering by graffiti and don't see any from you. I know <@!203220829473996800>'s prysm nodes are down. But it seems that essentially all of the points above 4 seconds are Nimbus

author: potuz
content: on the first two slots

author: potuz
content: and interestingly enough all of the points below 2 seconds are also Nimbus

content: Yes, been having some issues with Prysm io work during attestations being published. Prysm team is working on improvements there

author: potuz
content: There are many things that I am taking out of the per-client graph: all of lighthouse blocks are after 2 seconds, at all slots

author: potuz
content: sorry after 1 second

author: potuz
content: But this may be a skew on my node that is prysm, so this is measuring the delay that those blocks are taking to get to my node

author: potuz
content: I'd like to see if someone on lighthouse can carry the same analysis and report something different, cause that would point to network topology more than client performance, or at least rule this out
